Documentation¶

AnomalyExplanation¶

class anomaly_explanation.AnomalyExplanation(anomaly_feature, data, dtypes, predicate=None, column_to_values=None, predicate_data=None, predicate_dtypes=None, anomaly_feature_mean=None, anomaly_feature_std=None, log_bayes_factor=None, adjacent_ranks=None)¶

Bases: object

This class wraps a predicate and adds additional information for plotting.

Parameters

  • anomaly_feature (str) – Name of the column used as the anomaly score

  • data (pd.DataFrame) – Data that this explanation refers to

  • predicate (Predicate) – Predicate object defining the points covered by this explanation

convert_numpy(d)¶

Pixal¶

class pixal.Pixal(df=None, num_bins=15, num_points_per_bin=None, data=None, name=None, new_obj=False)¶

Bases: object

Main class for running PIXAL algorithm

Parameters

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – Data to run PIXAL on

  • num_bins (int) – Number of bins when converting numeric columns to ordinal

  • num_points_per_bin (int) – Number of points to include in each bin when converting numeric columns to ordinal

explain(method='expand_refine', predicates=None, maxiters=None, threshold=None, verbose=False, tracked_predicates=None)¶

Generate explanations.

Parameters

  • method (str) – Method that will be used to generate explanations (expand, refine, or expand_refine)

  • predicates (list) – List of predicates that will be used to start search, starts from scratch if None

  • threshold (float) – If a threshold is given the search will continue until an explanation is found with a Bayes factor that exceeds that threshold

Returns

List of explanations

Return type

list

get_features_explanations(features, explanations=None, include_subsets=True)¶

Get explanations that have been generated that include the given features.

Parameters

  • features (list) – List of features to be included in retrieved explanations

  • explanations (list) – List of explanations to search, searches self.explanations if None

  • include_subsets (True) – Whether or not to include explanations that have a subset of the given features

load()¶
plot_1d_binary(explanation_feature, explanations=None, ax=None, num_bins=None)¶

Plot data and explanations for one feature and a binary anomaly feature.

Parameters

  • explanation_feature (str) – Feature that will be plotted on the x-axis

  • num_bins (int) – Number of bins for x-axis, defaults to self.num_bins if None

  • ax (matplotlib.axes) – Axis to plot on

plot_1d_binary_anomaly(explanation_feature, ax, num_bins=None)¶

Plot data with one explanation feature and a binary anomaly feature.

Parameters

  • explanation_feature (str) – Feature that will be plotted on the x-axis

  • ax (matplotlib.axes) – Axis to plot on

  • num_bins (int) – Number of bins for x-axis, defaults to self.num_bins if None

plot_1d_binary_explanation(explanation, axis, ax)¶

Plot explanation with one explanation feature and a binary anomaly feature.

Parameters

  • explanation (AnomalyExplanation) – Explanation to plot

  • axis (str) – Axis to plot binary on, either ‘x’ or ‘y’

  • ax (matplotlib.axes) – Axis to plot on

plot_2d_binary(x, y, explanations=None, include_subsets=True, ax=None)¶

Plot data and explanations for two features and a binary anomaly feature.

Parameters

  • x (str) – Feature to plot on x-axis

  • y (str) – Feature to plot on y-axis

  • ax (matplotlib.axes) – Axis to plot on

  • plot_single (bool) – Plot explanations with x and y features if True, only plot explanations with both x and y if False

plot_2d_binary_explanation(explanation, x, y, ax)¶

Plot explanation with two explanation features and a binary anomaly feature.

Parameters

  • explanation (AnomalyExplanation) – Explanation to plot

  • x (str) – Explanation feature to plot on x-axis

  • y (str) – Explanation feature to plot on y-axis

  • ax (matplotlib.axes) – Axis to plot on

plot_feature(feature, explanations=None, include_subsets=True, ax=None, num_bins=None)¶

Plot explanations containing a given set of features along with the original data.

Parameters

  • feature (str, list) – Feature or list of features to plot

  • num_bins (int) – Number of bins for x-axis, defaults to self.num_bins if None

  • ax (matplotlib.axes) – Axis to plot on

  • plot_single (bool) – Plot explanations with x and y features if True, only plot explanations with both x and y if False

predicate_to_explanation(predicate)¶

Convert the given predicate instance to an explanation instance.

Parameters

predicate (Predicate) – Predicate to be converted

Returns

Converted explanation

Return type

AnomalyExplanation

predicates_to_explanations(predicates)¶

Convert the multiple predicate instances to explanation instances.

Parameters

predicates (list) – Predicates to be converted

Returns

Converted explanations

Return type

list

reset()¶

Reset the frontier, accepted, rejected, and conditionally accepted to empty lists.

save()¶
set_features(anomaly_feature=None, explanation_features=None, base_predicates=None, frontier=None, accepted=None, rejected=None)¶

Set the anomaly feature and/or explanation features.

Parameters

  • anomaly_feature (str) – Name of the column to be used as the anomaly score

  • explanation_features (list) – List of columns to be included in explanations
